text: Flaska. Svart öl med ett beigt skum. Dofter av kaffe, bränt gummi och lakrits. Smakinslag av kaffe, lakrits, laktos och karamell. Oljig munkänsla.

Dark chocolate, cacao, dark roast filter coffee, slightly charred, dark malts, old leather. Hazy, dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Light bitter and sweet. More chocolate, burnt molasses, charcoal, dark, burnt malts, soft carbonation, full bodied. Nice Sweet Stout, aroma maybe not quite as balanced as one would wish, nice palate though. Keg at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey.

Black, with a large tan head, sediments and circular lacing. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Complex taste, with the lactose that adds sweetness without overdoing, and a very nice thick mouthfeel. Roasted malts, coffee and chocolate are there, and so some mild hoppy bitterness. As I said full, bodied with thick mouthfeel, soft carbonation, and long finish, with all its flavours lingering. Bloody good sweet stout!
Robe noire avec des reflets rubis, fine mousse. dentelle sur le verre. Nez chocolat. Bouche chocolat, caramel, belle amertume, pin. Texture douce et crémeuse.

great beer pours into a great dark body with a large expansive toffee colored head. aroma like many milk stouts ive had before isnt too strong but thats definitely made up for later in the beer. when sipping you almost have to fight your way past the thick head to get to the body of the beer, the flavour bursts from the head giving a good sweet and dark chocolate bitterness.
Tap black colour with small off beige head.Aroma of coffee and hops hint of lactose and malt with slight roasted mouthfeels and light smooth taste and slight of chocolate and caramel.

Aromat: czekolada, rodzynki, szlachetne suszone owoce, wanilia, toffi, karmel. Aromat bardzo przyjemny.
Wygląd: Ciemnobrązowe, prawie czarne, ponad dwu centymetrowa, beżowa, bardzo ładna warstwa drobnopęcherzykowej piany, długo utrzymuje się na powierzchni piwa.
Smak: czekolada, pralinki, trochę kawy i paloności, kakao, laktozowa słodycz wyraźna, goryczka mocna, piwo jak na styl wytrawne, nie jest bardzo słodkie, a goryczka jest naprawdę mocna i zalega. Przyjemne likierowe odczucie w ustach, finisz lekko cierpki, alkohol ukryty, dużo ciała, gładkie, aksamitne, tylko może wysycenie ciut za duże. Wszystko jest tu bardzo dobrze wyważone, balans przesunięty lekko w stronę wytrawności. Pijalne i bardzo smaczne piwo.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Pours black with a beige foam. Aroma is sweet liquorice, intense dark dried fruit, motor oil. Body is medium, strong liquorice again, quite bitter, good sweetness, soft carbonation, lactose, thick. Lingering liquorice as well, and dark fruit. Not my type of beer, but it?s not bad.

Black. Rich, roasted malt profile, with notes of spice. Sweet, full taste that ends with a dry and solidly bitter finish. Full body, and a smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Overall, a great milk stout. Rich, tasty and smooth like velvet.

Butelka. Piana obfita, kawowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, opada bardzo powoli do cienkiej warstwy na powierzchni całego piwa, ładnie koronkuje. Barwa czarna. Aromat intensywny, słodki, mleczna czekolada, lekka kawa. Goryczka niska. W smaku kawa zbożowa (inka), czekolada do picia, lekka kwaśność od palonych słodów, lekka paloność. Gładkie w teksturze. Pełnia średnia plus, nasycenie niskie.

Aroma - roasted malt, some chocolate with milk and burnt fruit wood, some black fruits slightly smoked, yeasts. Taste - pleasant of a roasted malt with a bit of coffee and chocolate with milk, a bit of burnt malt, medium bitterness, some black fruits. Good.
its certainly a beautiful lookin beer, nice head, nice tint. the flavor itself is good, but perhaps doesnt come through strongly enough for my taste.
kindly shared by impuritylaw, thanks a lot. A doughy heaven of half-baked Marmorkuchen dunked into slightly sour/acrid coffee. Superb mouthfeel. Serves as a dessert.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, lactose, chocolate, mocha and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown/black beer with medium yeast and with a medium/large brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, lactose, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. That added lactose manages to never be too dominant. Together with the loads of roasted malts, there is a great chocooate and mocha present in this beer.

Aroma: Roasted malt with oats and liqorice. 
Flavour: Dark roasted malt with liqorice, slight fruity notes and brown sugar. 
Colour: black with a light brown head.

Bottle from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours black with a dark beige head. Aroma of chocolate,coffee & leafy & earthy notes . Taste is bitter chocolate,dark malt ,coffee & toasty notes . Medium bodied ,creamy & smooth with nice carbonation. The finish is bittersweet,dry with more chocolate,lactose ,coffee ,roasted grain with a balancing sweetness.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Bottle. Pours dark brown with smooth beige head. Chocolate, roasted malt, subtle hint of milk, hoppy. Medium carbonation. Overall very good and would gladly have again.

Nice aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, a herbal touch from hops
Persistent beige head
Not overly sweet, has a good hoppy counter.
Fitting low carbonation, medium-full body.

Zajebiste, na serio pyszne piwko. Pachnie super, najbardziej czuję gorzką czekoladę i kawę, niestety też zostawia gorzki posmak na języku :/ a liczylam na spotkanie ze słodyczką, ale ogólnie nie jest gorzkie. Zdecydowanie polecam nie tylko fanatykom milk stoutów

Bottle 0,33.
Dark brown color, big creamy beige head. Aroma: roasted, dark chocolate, a bit malty and hoppy, licorice. Taste: sweet, hoppy, lactose, chocolate. Medium body. Oily texture, soft carbonation.
33cl bottle. Black with a big beige head. Coffee, mocha, chocolate and nuts. Good.
33 cl bottle from Clapton craft Waltshamstow. Pours black with big head. Coffee aroma with milly notes. Creamy, coffee and sweet milky taste.
Bottle from my ex-colleagues. Thanks! Pours black with nice creamy brown head. Aroma is wood, coffee, chocolate, nuts. Taste is bitter and a little sweet, roasty hoppy with wood, coffee, peat.

from Erzbierschof - dark beer under a solid dark beige foam left; roasted aroma of mocha, notes of licorice and tobacco; full-bodied, creamy palate and fairly bitter; long roasted, coffeish and nutty finish; sweet/grainy

W aromacie wytrawne, chmielowe, czekoladowe, lekko prażone, kawowe. W smaku również sporo kawy i czekolady, chmielowa wytrawność na kształt black IPA robi wrażenie świeżości i rześkości. Laktozy nigdy nie umiałem wyłowić w milk stoucie. Piwo jest bardzo piernikowe ale nie dosłownie. Wytrawne - piernikowe. Palony słód mocno wyczuwalny. Goryczka przyjemna średnia, lekko kwaskowe, słodkawe na końcu co doceniam. Piana którą zwykle olewam zwraca na siebie uwagę - jest gęsta trwała i czekoladowa - a taką mają piwa staranne. Nie jest to mój styl ale z drugiej strony nie spodziewałem się że da się z milk stoutu wykręcić taki numer. Alkohol oczywiście niewyczuwalny, jedynie pijalność jak na mój gust słaba.

Looks great, beautiful head. Aroma is a lot of sweet milk chocolate, some dark fruit and unfortunately some soy sauce (quite strong at the beggining, gets weaker as beer gets warmer). Taste is really nice, quite sweet obviously. The beer is not thicc enough tho.

Partagée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans nos petits verres Duvel 18cl: Jolie robe ébène avec une belle mousse couleur café assez persistante et une bonne carbonatation.Le nez nous offre un mélange darômes très riches et agréables avec des notes houblonnées et chocolatées.La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec des pointes dagrumes et une bonne amertume en finale.Un très bon stout avec cet équilibre parfait entre douceur et amertume! 17,5/20

Dégustée avec mon petit Kittenbieer dans un verre Duvel 18cl.
Température de début 9° environ.
Magnifique robe ébène surmontée dune belle mousse couleur café assez persistante;bonne carbonatation.
Nez particulièrement agréable : arômes chocolatés et houblonnés.
Le goût est du même niveau avec des saveurs fruitées et de café torréfié le tout dans un parfait équilibre douceur/amertume.
On note une astringence bienvenue.
La finale très longue et sur lamertume est tout aussi plaisante.
Un stout soyeux très réussi qui évoque aussi les meilleures IPA.
17,5/20

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: caramel, milky sweet coffee and roasted malt. Taste: full body with roasted malt, coffee and milky notes. Lactic. Creamy sensation. Good attenuation. Very nice. Aftertaste: sweet milky and coffee.

Welp, this is crazy stupid good. By Udder Means sports a lame pun for a name and a whole lot of lactose. Black pour. Aroma has cream, milk chocolate, and roasted barley. It tastes like chocolate with a bit of espresso. Rich creamy feel. This brew feels much larger than the relatively modest 7%. This beers got a sweet tooth but still has lots of class, too.

Draft.

A- Chocolate ice cream.

A- Black color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Chocolate, mild bitterness, slightly roasty.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty finish.

O- Amazing aroma that doesnt quite translate into the palate. Almost like liquid ice cream.

Big tan head. Nice aroma of coffee and roasty malt. I didnt find it that sweet considering its a milk stout. There is an initial sweet hit followed by a lasting taste of dark chocolate, nuts, quite dry with a bitterness. Could do with being a touch sweeter to balance it out but tasty stuff none the less.
Bottle. Black in colour, big head. Aroma of dark malts, some roastiness and lactose. In taste sweet with coffee, quite simple. Medium body, high level of carbonation, finish is sweet.

Bottle; pours nearly black with a tan head; aroma of chocolate and vanilla with hints of coffee and lactose; taste is chocolate, roast coffee, and hints of lactose; bittersweet finish with some roasted notes and chocolate; nice beer

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, oats, lactose, milk, tar, smoke and dried fruits. The color is pitch black with a minimal and brown head. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, milk, lactose, oats, smoke, tar, rope and dried fruits. Nice beer!

Nieprzejrzyście czarne, z bujną, beżową pianą. W aromacie czekolada, kawa, kakao, nutka nowofalowego chmielu. W smaku dominuje paloność, do tego dochodzi gorzka czekolada, kawa, delikatna laktoza i kwaśność od ciemnych słodów; goryczka średnio wysoka. Piwo dosyć gęste, przyjemnie gładkie, bardzo pijalne.
Van de tap @Uiltjebar. Mooi zwart bier. Heerlijk zacht en vol van smaak, zoet-bitter, een prachtige sweet stout.

Draught
Aroma-fruits, caramel, coffee
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium sourness, lightly bitter, 
Palate-medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle from Firma Bier, BB 23/02/21, large sample. Dark color, big rocky brown head. Aroma of lots of roast, dark bread, lactose, slight coffee, bit rye. Bit fruity in taste, lots of roasty bitterness, coffee, dsrk chocolate, bit lactose sweetness. Good balance, good beer.

Bottle from The Party Source at home. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malt, a mix of milk and dark chocolate, Belgian chocolate, lactose sugar, medium plus body, smooth, decent beer.

Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter kaffe og mørk sjokolade. Middels fylde. Kaffen og sjokoladen EE der også i smaken. Noe salt lakris og kakaopulver. Ett noe syrlig innslag kommer også i starten. Saltbitter avslutning.
backlog. draft. Black with a small off white head. Aroma of coffee and cream, silky mouthfeel. Very good

Aroma: chocolate, coffee, cherry, milky, toffee
Taste: light sweet, light bitter, roasty, chocolate, cherry, earthy

330ml bottle pours black in color with a huge light brown head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is chocolate and vanilla with some dark roasted grains. Taste is a chocolate malty sweetness with a dark roasted grain bitterness. Full bodied with good carbonation that pleases the palate. Overall, a wonderful stout that must be sampled. Excellent brew.

Bottle from Bottle Baron, Edin. Pours very dark brown. Lovely tan coloured, thick fluffy head. Herbal hop aromas kick things off which i didnt see coming. Unexpected dankness and pine. Roastier notes come through. Some strongly-brewed coffee. Smooth vanilla. Toasted coconut. Some light tropical fruits in there too. Lovely full mouthfeel. Syrupy but not claggy. Light sweetness then heavier, darker notes come through. Mocha. Bitter espresso. A fairly punchy and peppery bitterness strikes a balance. Has length. More sweet vanilla smoothness towards the finish. Slightly dry. Minimum carbonation. A little too hoppy to be my perfect milk stout but its extremely enjoyable nonetheless!

Dark brown, great, long lasting brown head. Aroma: almost like barley wine; toast, cereal, caramel, chocolate. Heavy to medium sweetness, full body, medium to high bitterness. Two layers in flavour, first is malty sweetness nicely integrated with bit of lactose and some licorice, second layer is dark malts with quite sharp roastiness (although theres nice hint of lactose at finish). Bit noticeable alcohol in taste. Dessert beer.

Negra, opaca, coronada por una espuma beige con buena retención. 
En nariz; pino, café con leche, cacao, torrefacta. En boca; carbonatación media y cuerpo medio. 
Sabor; bastante resinosa, quemada, solvente, final seco y con toques a café amargo. Descompensada. Aún así, un copazo recomendable.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with a thick, resilient beige head. Aroma is chocolate, milk, coffee, cream. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, lactose, burnt caramel. Finish is coffee, hazelnut, wood, roast. Medium to full body, weak to average carbonation. Solid.

7 is not a low alcohol percentage FFS. Bottle. Black with a tan head that collapses to a 1/2 cm. 3 More fudgy than roasty aroma with Indian sweet shop spices, some coffee, pine, vague citrus, pineapple.7+ Yes very silky. Nice smooth and sweet with mocha, vanilla, gentle roast, dark sugars, hints of tropical fruit. But pine and medicinal bitter flavours run over the top. Aftertaste of licorice and menthol. Not harmonious. Get the feeling these guys are being "clever" for its own sake.

Brown bottle, 330ml. Pours dark dark brown with a perfect brown head subsiding slowly. Scent is sour yeast, caramel, brown sugar, and other complexities that I cannot name. Taste is super dense, super bitter roasted malt with flavors of coffee, toffee, whiskey, and hickory smoke. Mouthfeel is medium dense and with a nice warming feel. Great.

Black pour with a thick, tan head. Floral hops, milk chocolate, roasty malt aromas. Taste is sweetish, dark chocolate, liquorice, and some hoppy bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, bitter milky coffee finish.
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 Mooie zwarte kleur met een volle bruine kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, crème, vanille. Smaakt vol crème, vanille, bitter. Fruitige bittere, zoetig, koffie afdronk.

Mar. 16. A 0.33 l bottle. It poured almost black body with cocoa brown head. Aroma of licorice, dark fruit, coffee, cocoa and some alcohol. Fine, smelled just like an IS. Lightly sweet, dark fruit, cocoa, touch of yogurt. There was also some very light hop bitterness. Medium in body with very smooth palate and long, rounded, finish, where herbal bitter was rounded and overwhelmed by pleasant chocolate malt. Sweet stouts can get really ugly but this was pleasant, not really sweet, just like a regular one. Nice.
Pretty hoppy for a sweet stout. Not sweet at all. More like a black ipa. Wtf, im udderly disappointed? Tasted at Wilsons cousins trip.

Aromat intensywny, kawa, paloność, czekolada, likier czekoladowy, karmel, kakao, słodkie owoce. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzyste. Piana beżowa, obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, średnio trwała, ładny lacing. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, czekolada, laktoza, kawa, paloność, popiół. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie niskie. Świetne piwo!

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się piękna, beżowa piana, dość trwała i z niezłym lajsingiem. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat intensywny, zdominowany przez mleczną czekoladę, likier kakaowy, trufle. W smaku dokładnie to samo co w zapachu, dodatkowo odrobina nut tytoniowych, popiołowych, karmelowych, w odczuciu dość słodkie, pełne, lekko szorstkie, z niewielką kwaskowością od ciemnych słodów. Goryczka średnia, palona. W afterteasie posmaki rumowo likierowe, rozgrzewające, przyjemne. Niskie nagazowanie.
Świetny Milk Stout, jeden z najlepszych, jakie piłem (oczywiście w wersji nie BA). Jest sporo słodyczy, sporo ciała, treściwość, intensywność - klasa!

Ps.

Warka do 08/06/20.

Bouteille de 330 ml dégustée chez La Succursale (Montréa, QC) au coût de 13,00$. Arôme: Odeur de chocolat avec une pointe de noix. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun moyen col brun et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de chocolat avec une pointe de lactose et petits fruits. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement crémeuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de lactose en arrière goût. (Rating #6865)

Very dark brown poue with a soft, tall tan head that is slow to rise to the surface. Pine and grapefruit up front, followed by milk chocolate, lactose, cocoa, licorice and a bit of vanilla. A milk stout leaning towards a pine-forward black IPA. Right up my alley.
Flaske 0,33L på Cafe Sånn med djoeye. Sort med beige skum. Kaffe, noe syrlig. Kaffe, mørke bær, søtlig, halvtørr i ettersmaken, alkoholen er godt pakket inn. En veldig god stout

Rose beige top, jet black body.
Aroma of liquoriced sour fruits, roasted
juicy malts, black chocolate with acidic raisins.
Tastes caramels, nougatish chocolate, coffee 
cocoa, plums, almond, and finishes
fruity malty n warming.
Soft and fully on palate, semi dry.
Overall varied, tasty, bodiful, quality sipper.
[33cl btl 7%abv @CafeSånn Tromsø]

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a beautiful dark brown colour with a marvellous thick pale brown head, prominent and dense; brilliant lacing as expected. Very floral aromas, those you would expect from hoppy IPAs, herbal, not as much malt as I had expected though. An uncommon aroma for any sort of stout/porter-like beer. Dark chocolate and malty flavours, toasted, also hazelnuts, sweet but with an astringent finish, very clever. Resin too, which accounts for a bit of the overly pine-like character. Some might consider this a drawback, others might like intense hops in every beer they drink (I personally prefer more neutral stouts). Very complex and intricate, but that resinous bite is not one I enjoy too much; either way, its spot on in terms of its DEVELOPING taste - set this as an example for a beer that is not one-dimensional. Finish is too hoppy, just like a black IPA. Medium to full body, oily to creamy texture, a beer to devote time to, definitely not a light one. Citrus is very subtle, but can be imagined if thought hard enough. Im going to pair this one up (after this review, o as not to "cross-contaminate" my reviews!) with some nice dark chocolate, lets see how it goes.

Bottle. Black body with a thick tan head. Good lacing. Aroma of blackcurrants, cherries, ash and tar. Flavour of liquorice, plum and chocolate covered marshmallow. Medium body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. An outrageously good, which sits somewhere between a Sweet Stout and a Black IPA.

Hatalmas, gyönyörű, tömör barna hab, fekete szín. Édeskés, kávés, pörkölt malátás illatvilág, a komlók közbeszólásával. Először a laktóztól eredő édesség érezhető, párhuzamosan a komló gyümölcsös aromájával, majd a komló és a pörkölt maláta keserűje együtt bukkannak elő, fokozatosan erősödve. Aztán a korty száraz kakaóporossággal cseng le, de az alkohol is kiköszön mögüle. Utóíze szárazon kesernyés, némi kakaóssággal és pörkölt malátás utánérzéssel. Testes, finom, jól összerakott sör.

Bottle from Tebay services on the M6. Sweet, almost floral aroma. Opaque with very little head. The taste belies the aroma - the residual hoppiness eventually gives way to some chocolatey sweetness: not unpleasant, just a surprise!

Pours a black color, topped with decently sized and slowly settling beige head. Nice and easy t pick up aroma of some milk chocolate wit some coffee notes in the back. Also some mild hoppy notes, grassy in a way. A hint of bourbon leaks through as well. Mild sweetness upfront, chocolate and coffee presence in the body, slightly burned coffee feel, but just in the first few sips. Quite nice and solid hoppy bitterness in the finish. Alcohol is very nicely hidden, with just a hint of it in the back. Slight soury grains feel also present. Medium full body. Very nice.

Bottle 0.33l from Beer Club Shop in Rijeka, Cro. Thick dark liquid with big tan head. Foam is very tasty, aroma of chocolate, toffee and something that reminds me of sea smell. Sounds strange but I like it. Body is full, carbonation medium. Rich in taste, cocoa, caramel, roast taste. Long finish. Feels like something with more than 7% of alcohol. Very nice.

Dark brown color, big creamy brown head that refused to disappear. Very strong cocoa aroma, roastiness, dark fruits, caramel. Taste is similar, but much more milky and fruity, some hops also. Long cocoa finish. Sweet on the lips, slightly sticky, silky, creamy texture, medium to full body, soft carbonation. Awesome, awesome stuff.

aroma: predominantly roast, coffee. soe milk chocolate, cocoa, alcohol. 
black, hazy, minimal head, off-white foam, not so good retention. very light sweetness, lightly bitter. overly full body, thick feel (would enjoy creamy more), flat, astringent, alcoholic. 
overall a heavy beer that isnt balanced that well. the roastiness is put off balance by thickness, lots of alcohol feel (might be higher alcohols).
To Øl always hit my sweetspot, theese guys know how to brew em Stouts. No exeption here, surprisingly thick & rich for a 7%er
Very decent Milk stout. Good lactose. Full american style.good is.world of beer.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate with a strong floral hops presence. Has chocolate and coffee notes, along with some lactose for the flavor. Also more roasted malt, and possibly licorice. Not nearly as sweet as I expected. Medium to full-bodied. Decent.

Aroma: extreme bitter/burned aroma; Im a little afraid; Appearance: pitch black with thick, tan head that dissipates slowly; some lacing; Taste: also very bitter and burned; a bit of sweetness but overall not balanced; Palate: heavy with long, burned finish; Overall: not sure if its the style or this beer, but definitely not pleasant; can appreciate that its decent quality but would not buy again.

Rated la 13.02.2016.bottle. Some pine green hoppyness on nose, roast, dark chocolate maltyness. Full bodied, some citrus, lots of pine, malty roasty, nice bittery finish. Clean, super nice. A really nice hoppy bitter stout.-- bb
KØLF 131115. Dark brown colour with a tan head. Aroma is cocoa, roasted malt, lactose, coffee. Flavour is cocoa, roasted malt, coffee, lactose, chocolate, dried fruits. Nice beer.
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of grains, coffee, sweet malts and some cocoa. Taste is sweet, chocolate and coffee.
Bottle from beer metro, Leicester. Black colour with a really foamy head. Aroma is sweet roasted malt. Taste thick sweet. Really thick body.

Bottle. Lactose slickness that supercedes the orasted tartness, but is in turn absolutely wrecked by the strong, roasted bitterness in the finish. Long aftertaste af a slice of bread burned to a crisp. The aroma is very nice, with chocolate, coffee, bready roast and some mineral notes. The taste is unbalanced and the aftertaste too long. Sort of an extreme milk stout.

With Z, watching the Barcelona futbol game, pours rich dark black pour with an ephemeral Java head . Nose is sweet Java malt . As described, not overly sweet, rich mocha java taste, and very smooth and silky . Finish is dry, with a moderately long mocha tasty ending . Very very nice ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head and aroma of sweet chocolate and malt notes. Taste is chocolately, nice sweet notes, with roasted malt, dark fruits, lactose, and a creamy mouthful into the chocolate finish. Delicious stout

Bottle. Deep brown color with a medium sized foamy beige head. Aroma of licorice and roasted malt. Bitter taste with some sweetness. Bitter finish. Medium to full body. A bit oily feel.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
-------- tasted two years ago.

Huge thanks to Heavy who gave it to me, shared it with Vinja, Goran and Hrabren. Almost pitch black body with some light amber notes. Sharp roasty coffee aroma, malty. Sweet roasty malty notes with lovely herbal-lemony hoppiness popping up here and there and lactose sweetness just slightly rearing its head here & there (not entirely absent as per deScription if I remember correctly). Very light chocolate. Though initially a tad rough, this is a very, very enjoyable stout. And I could expect nothing less from this brewery!

0.33 l bottle, courtesy of Marko and Natko. Dark brown to black with medium off white to tan head. Leather, smoke, black malts. Chocolate and roasted malts. Medium bitterness, aromatic finish. Full body. Not very sweet, not very milky, but good.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Opaque black with medium light brown head. Aroma is nice lactose, thick body, medium carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is roasty, burnt malt, anise, some lactose, and slightly dry finish. Not that malty, pretty heavy for the ABV, but pretty good.
Bottle at home. Pours black with a bubbly white head. Aroma of roasted coffee. Chocolate, slight dark fruit. Nice balanced sweetness. Smooth finish. Very enjoyable :)

33cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a thick espresso head. Mocha, creme brulee, chocolate. Massive aroma. Velvety smoothness. Flavor has lactose, chocolate pudding, cocoa powder. Intensive, very flavorful. Nice dessert beer. Not too sweet either. Great!

Black colored, tan frothy head, good lasting. Aroma is milky and dark chocolate, brown sugary, pine and citrus resiny hops, milky. Taste is medium sweet milk chocolate, dark chocolate, bit sugary, roasted malt, some lactose, medium strong pine and citrus hops, medium+ bitterness, dry finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy and resiny. Excellent!

Bottle @ home from To Øls Christmas Calendar. Aroma of US/citrus hops, roasted malt, some chocolate and coffee. Black with lasting tan head. Taste is light+ malt bitterness, moderate sweetness (but controlled). Full body, thick smooth texture, light carb., sweet roasted malt finish.

Bottle at Hopfanatic. Black colour with a thick brown, long lasting head. Nose of chocolate and coffee. Taste is also dominated by coffee and chocolaty notes with a bit of bitterness in the end. Palate is thick, heavy, with medium carbonation. A nice beer with a definitive character.

Dark brown-black with a frothy tan head and good lacings. Aromas of roast malts, milk chocolate, coffee and herbal notes develop. Lightly carbonated and smooth texture offering a rather full body. Light chocolatey sweetness with light spicey herbal liquorice notes and a well balanced roast bitterness. Lasting finish.
Stout di buona intensità, caffè e cioccolato in dose parsimoniosa ma ben calibrata, malto, avena, zucchero a velo. Non impazzisco per lo stile classico ma questa è molto piacevole.

Sheer milk chocolate, roasted barley, malted milk, cashew pralines, and milk caramel contrast with surprisingly dank, almost fruity/citrusy hops that yield fresh orange peel, grapefruit, and grassy notes. Baffling and a bit messy, but very engaging. The mouthfeel is creamy, with moderate carbonation and a medium body. The taste is medium, roasty bitter that devolves into milky, chocolatey sweetness, culminating with a slightly tangy finish suggesting citrus notes and buttermilk underneath the roasty, cerealy, chocolatey main act. It demands your attention. Otherwise, it can come off as messy. But oh it got me.
Nice roasty and caramel aroma. Pretty dark and creamy color with a smooth palate. Chocolate with a hint of nuttiness. Slight sweetness.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt, some lactose, malt and fruitiness. FLavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, roasted notes and ash. Medium body, average carbonation.
Very dry and bitter black IPA, but very tasty. Bottle from Beerhawk. Lovely large chocolate brown head.
bottle a black colored beer with a beige head aroma roasted malts coffee chocolate spicy fruits and hops flavor roasted malts spicy coffee chocolate spicy fruits some caramel some yeast and hops
Bottle 330 ml. Aroma: coffee with milk, caramel and wine. Pleasant taste with noticeable sweetness and coffee, roasted, velvety, brandy.

Pitch black in color, light tan head... Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malts... Flavor is definitely less sweet than your typical milk stout, lots of roasted malts, dark chocolate notes... Almost a grainy homebrew hop note on finish... Decent 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at "na 7.schode", Zilina. Pours is dark with thick brown head, leaves lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, milk chocolate, coffee, light licqourice, ligh plum. Taste is moderate sweet, light bitter, coffee mouthfeel. Medium body, oily texture, light bitter finish, coffee mouthfeel.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl à la Franche,
couleur brune/noire mousse brune et effervescence moyenne.
Nez cacao et chocolat.
En bouche attaque sur le café, le grillé et fin de bouche assez douce et ronde comme si la petite pointe du lactoserum faisait reposer le tout très bon

Je trouve ça très agréable ! crémeux et doux avec en sous main, la force dun stout assagi. Avec une pointe houblonné pour pas que ça roupille non plus. A noter aussi, un très joli col de mousse peu épais mais doté de nombreuses bulles fines. Vraiment, une bonne surprise délicate pour un dimanche soir alors que dehors le temps fraîchit !
Bottle @ csakajosor darker brown head. Nose of cocoa and earth, but mostly cocoa. Tases like my mothers cafe latte. The milk (lactose) is distinct but very nice.

330 ml bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Black body, with a big, dense, creamy, lacing, dark beige head.
Aroma of coffee, lactose, dark chocolate, cocoa, some ash, some liquorice, slight hops.
Tastes of coffee, lactose, cocoa, bitter chocolate, liquorice, some ash, citric hops from the background.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty-bitter, dry, with coffee, wood, liquorice, slight ash, long-lasting citric hop notes.

Really tasty. Quite opposing aromas, with roast, lactose, some ash and surprising amounts of hops, but very well balanced, so that it all fits together and drinks really smooth. The lactose and the hops lead to a fresh impression, the ABV isnt noticable at all. Among the best Milk Stouts Ive had so far.
Ladna, bezowa piana. Aromat mocno palony, wrecz risowy, ale lamany przez owoce (winogrona). Jest tez odczuwalna popiolowosc. Nieco za wysoko wysycone. Palony aftertaste. Laktoza prawie nieodczuwalna.

Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours black with reddish hues. Lactose, coffee, floral, chocolate nose. Flavour is liquorice, lactose, milk chocolate with a dry sweet tobacco coffee finish. Not a style Im crazy about but nice example.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours black with creamy beige head. Aroma of coffee, cacao, vanilla, hay, dark dried fruits, fruity hops. Taste malty sweet, with bitterness from both roasted malt and hops. Silky mouth feel.

Szuper
Kis sztout, aranyfeketébe bújtatva, és cukorral felturbozva. Ördögien keserű.
Poured black with big light brown head. Sweet malty, chocolate aroma. Sweet chocolate and coffee flavour. Lots of lactose in this one. Very sweet, very nice but wouldnt drink too many. Nice treat

Semplicemente nera; schiuma abbondante, cremosa, soffice, di ottima persistenza. Al naso dominano caffè espresso e cioccolato, accompagnati la leggere punte floreali; si avvertono anche note di cereali e pane appena sfornato. Questo mix, rende tutto rotondo e finemente decorato da ciliegie nere. Il palato è morbido, pieno e cremoso in perfetta armonia con il naso. Caffè e ciliegia dominano con note di cenere e carbone. Linsieme è morbido e dolce, ma vira abbastanza velocemente verso lamaro del caffè. La carbonazione è bassa, nel retrogusto si avvertono note di anacardi e nocciole; un tocco di Gin e Sambuco. Il finale rimane un pò più amaro rispetto allattacco, virando su note di caffè e liquirizia.

7%ABV. Sweet Stout. 

Poured out of the bottle a beautiful glossy black brown. 40°SRM.

Nose is clean , grassy and clear sugar sweet.
Nice malty flavors. The added lactose was a stroke of genius. Few other stouts have as inviting a nose. 

Pronounced carbonation. Umami. Short hoppy finish. Clean finish. Deep dark roasted flavors. Sweet malts. Burnt milk pudding. Alcohol is very well balanced. Beware the sneaky kick in the pants. Also if you do get kicked in the pants, itll never be sweeter than by the fine folks at To Øl. 

Goes on favorites list.

Bottle at home. Almoust black with thick beige head leaving nice laces. Aroma is mediocre roasted with coffee, cocoa and dark chocolate. Some alcohol in backround. Very nice. Taste is milk chocolate, roasted malts, coffee and strong chocolate bitterness. Palate is over medium. Aroma is the best part. Very enjoyable anyways.

Tap 
Color: black with a bit of brown 
Head: non-existent 
Aroma: roasted malts, milk, chocolate 
Taste: lactose, roasted malts, dark chocolate finish.

coffee, cocoa and smells like metal (!?) thick dark brown colour with a tan head that seems to be intent on staying around, deep smooth dark chocolate bitterness with that metallicness coming through in the finish with far too much alcohol burn.

Nice roasty aroma. Some sweetness too. Pours black with a nearly white lace of head from tap. Really great roasted flavor. No bitterness at first and whats theres super gentle. Sweet and smooth. The bitterness is a great coffeeishness. I dont really get much chocolate. Good thick body and really low carb.

On bottle at James Clarke, Sandefjord. Pitch black color, ok offwhite foam. Lightly roasted, good malt, coffee & leather - some milk. Medium/ full body & complexity . Some light immediate sweetness- balances well. Best milk stout so far- very Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from BeerGeek Bottle Shop. Dark with a large compact tan head that stays there for a long time. The aroma is bitter by chocolate and coffee, some vanilla sweetness and sweet dark dried fruits. Full body and a smooth, dry mouthfeel. The taste got roasted coffee, dark chocolate, herbal hops, caramel. Finish dry with some bitterness.
Niemalże wzorcowy słodki stout z toolowym sznytem, który jest cechą charakterystyczną ciemnych piw z tego browaru. Pyszny

Keg at Beergeek. Pours Black with a Brown head. Looks dramatic. Aroma of dense charred malt. Very full taste. Chocolate, coffee and resinous hops. Very dry and bitter. I usually refrain from milk stout because I expect it to have an irrational sweetness and that was not the case here. Delicious.

Pours a black body with a foamy dark khaki head that leaves spots of lace around the glass. Smell is of dark roasted malts, milk, cocoa, and black licorice. Taste is much the same with cocoa and licorice flavors on the finish. This beer has a lower level of carbonation with a slightly crisp and medium bodied, slightly sticky mouthfeel. Overall, this is a nice beer, gotta be the best milk stout i have tried.
Pours dark with beige head. Aroma is roasted, licorice. Flavour is roasted, light to medium bitter and medium to heavy sweet.

Dark brown clear colour with mousse-like firm light brown head. Aroma is without presence of alcohol, but with evident presence of hops (reminiscences of tropical fruit, but prevailing notes of malts: vanilla, chocolate, plums, coffe, lactose. 
Taste is also without presence of alcohol. You can detect hops - tropical fruit, pine, little citrous, but than prevails sweet malty notes: chocolate, little roasted, coffee. Hop bitterness is high, malt sweetness is medium.
Body is dry and soft, bitterness is medium, also in finish, with dry long lasting bitter finsh.
Very good sweet stout.
Decent enough, but for me not that great. Has good mouthfeel, but its just a little plain.
Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Dark brown with light brown head. Roasted malts, fruit and coffee, hops. Medium bodied. Quite drinkable and very interesting.

12 ounce bottle poured into a brandy snifter. Near black beer with a grey head of foam. The aroma has big earthy bitterness and roast. The taste is moderately sweet, but carries through on the bitterness. A pretty different take on a sweet stout. Very enjoyable.
From tap at Fermentoren. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of chocolate, caramel, roasted malt, fruit and hops.

Tap at cottonwood. Pours black with a nice brown head. Aroma is coffee, a bit of milk and sugar, milk chocolate. Smells great. Taste is creamy, milk chocolate, espresso, sweet coffee. Faint cream. Creamy palate, medium carbonation.  Really sweet, a bit much for a full beer.

Tap at Cottonwood. Very dark dense pour with a clingy beige head. Licorice and dark fruity sweetness all over this. Coats the lips with extreme sweetness. But in a pretty cool way. Taster size is more than enough, but fun.

Bottle. Medium sized brown head. Dark colour. Nice citrusy, roasted malt aroma. Taste is dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malts, bitter, coffee. Soft carbonation, medium body, creamy. Long bittersweet cocoa coffe finish. Great combination.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours black with a medium brown head. Aromas of roasted coffee, milky sweetness, chocolate, hops, some roasted malts, vanilla and cocoa. Taste is pretty roasty, chocolate, milky sweetness, hops.

On tap, urbanhouse. Dark, black colour with brown head. Aroma roasted, espresso, caramel, some licorice, a bit alcohol and some hops.  Taste mostly roasted, some caramel, sweetness a bit, some alcohol in taste. A bit earthy taste.
Aroma is effervescent yeast, dark malts and candy/sugar. The flavor is coffee, lactose sweetness, dark malts, slight earthy notes and a dryish/mildly sour finish.
Tap @ TCBW 2015. Typical stoutish aroma. Very moderate. Semi bitter taste. Is my lactose intolerant belly going to handle this?

Bottle in the Trembling Madness, York. Deep brown, almost black with a cream head. The taste is chocolate and moderate spice. Creamy with some sticky sweetness. Very tasty. Perhaps just a touch too spicy.

Bouteille achetée A la Mise en Bière - De couleur noir avec une mousse beige qui tient bien et laisse une jolie dentelle sur le verre - Au nez tout de suite des houblon agrumeux, citron grapefruit, puis du malt rôti, café, chocolat - En bouche toujours autant de houblon, puis du chocolat du café - médium full body, bonne amertume, bonne carbonation, amère et crémeuse, longue final amère agrume et café - un mélange de sweet stout et de black IPA, très bien réalisée comme la plupart de leurs bière

Growler from mchughs. Pours pitch black with dark brown mostly lasting head. Aroma is of coffee, chocolate, hint of dark fruit and vanilla. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oatmeal, warm hint of alcohol on the finish. Light to medium carbonation, oily body. Gorgeous.

Draught at PMacs, To Ol tap takeover. Black as you like, tan head. Chocolate and coffee nose, big robust flavour with plenty of chocolate, lovely silky mouthfeel, long finish, quite bitter too so not all sweet. Very nice indeed.
Bottle from Metro Wines, Syston. Really delicious beer. Light, frothy body. Smooth, slightly sweet. Really nice hoppy tang - like an Impy, but without the booze hit. Super drinkable.

@ Cerveteca Lisboa. Black color with a creamy and dense tan head. Aroma has strong coffee notes and black chocolate with notes of ripe fruit. Flavor is toasty, slightly roasty, notes of coffee, slightly sweet with bittery notes in the final. Creamy, smooth and roasted malts in the final.

Botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 18/04/2015 BBD:01/07/19
Color negro espuma beige, aromas torrefactos y dulces, sabor tostado y amargo.

Draft. Poured dark brown color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted chocolate malt aroma. Medium to full body and a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. Interesting complex beer.

Bottle. Pours an opaque black with a dark latte head. Aroma is roast, coffee, lactose, light lactose sour, earthiness. Taste is the roast combined with the lactose and earthiness to form something lightly sour, definitely good. Finishes with some citrusy hoppiness. Some coffee too. Fairly strong lactose sweetness in the aftertaste. Very good.

33 cl. bottle. Pitch black with a big, creamy tanned head. Roasted aroma with dark malts, herbal hops, pines, caramel, chocolate, coffee and berries. Taste is bitter. Full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Long lasting roasted finish with dark chocolate, pines and a subtle lactic note. Lovely, rich Stout.

Bottled at Craft Republic. Opaque black colour, stone fruits notes in aroma(american hop), taste is way too bitter for a milk stout even this beer have full body and malty background. But stil its not the beer you can wait from a milk stout much closer to american stout.

4oz on tap at Libertys for $4.50. Black color. Good thin tan head. Leaves good reaches of lace. Good moderate roast, dark and milk chocolate, some mustiness. Some toasty malt, and a touch of belgian-type sweetness. Moderate-plus sweet taste, lighter bitter, some of that lactose sugar. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Kind of slick. Full feel. A solid milk stout. Good roast, touch of coffee, dark chocolate notes. Just a touch too sugary sweet for me, though.

Bottled 330ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Black coloured, medium sized brown head, chocolate and touch of ash in the nose. Roasted malt, chocolate, weak licorice and hops with notes of alcohol and chocolate in the finish. Not so challenging stout but pretty good.
Tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend 2015. Originally rated 28032015. Colour is black with small head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, sweetness, some lactoce and roasted malts.

Pitch blach beer with a nice beige and long lasting head. Aroma is sweet and kind of soapy with notes of chocolate. Pretty thich and creamy mouthfeel - not overly complex but nonetheless quite well ballanced between bitter and sweet. Lingers for a while - very drinkable.

Black beer with beige head on top. Aroma has roasted malts, coffee and some chocolate. Taste has roasted malts and some sweetness. A bit light taste with not that much components. Full body and carbonation was medium.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Dark brownish black with tan head. Aromas of roast, pencil shavings, light dark fruit. Tastes of roast, chocolate, caramel, sweet milk. Medium body with a dry finish. Okay.

Purchased this 330 ml bottle at a random Liquor store in Tampa, (cant remember the name) pitch black with thin off white head. Aroma is real nice. Roasted malts, roasted coffee bean, and a light oak type / earth note. 
The body is fuller with a smooth, creamy texture, exactly what I what in the style. The flavor has a larger hop presence that I was not expecting. Really caught me off guard with the level of bitterness. The roasted malt and coffee is here with the balance of the bitterness. The hop variety gives a subdued citrus note. The hope profile cant be ignored. But the major plus side is this bottle didnt sit around forever on the shelf. Without a doubt this is better than average and any stout lover or Black IPA fan should enjoy this beauty.

330ml bottle, pours black with a foam tan head. Aroma is full of roasted malts, with lots of citrus hop, zesty and tangy in the middle. Body is thin for a stout, the lactose doesnt fill this out as much as I would expect, has the feel of a black IPA, a good one though. Bitter, short finish with soft carbonation.

Above average for the style, but flawed, at least in the case of this bottle. Falls down on the mouthfeel. A distractedly quick pour gave an inch of charcoal brown body and four inches of rocky foam. A more traditional balance developed in less than a minute. Rich aroma of dark chocolate, cappuccino and port. Surprisingly thin in the body, considering the brewers stated intention. May have lost condition in the bottle or somewhere on the voyage to Oz. Rather than fluffy, this one was slick with very muted carbonation. Didnt really flatter the style. Sweet and milky - can taste the lactose. Good bitterness. Sweet chocolate, vanilla. Minor disappointment. (330ml bottle from Leura Cellars. BB 1/7/19)
Color is black with brown head. Aroma is citrus, roasty and coffee. Taste is a bit sweet and with bitter finish. Nice balance. Very good.
Black with lightbtan head. Piney grapefruit aroma with chocolate notes. Sweetish chocolate and passionfruit flavour. Thick and fluffy mouthfeel, long bitter finish.

Bottle, 7%. Very roasted aroma, some citric aroma hop. Black colour. Big stable dark brown head. The flavour is nicely citric. Has a piney, citric, and jammy hop note. The malt is sweetish and nicely roasted.

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with stable light tan head. Clear aroma of roast and hops, with notes of liquorice and malt. Bitter, roasty flavour, with notes of coffee, liquorice and C-hops. Bitterish and roasty aftertaste with notes of citrus. Not much sweetness about this Sweet Stout, but okay.
dark chocolate and coffe aromas, appear black with a fine brown head. taste light sweet light bitter smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation, light bitter aftertaste.
A lot of cream in this. To the extent where its a bit sour. Creamy consistency. Black pour with mocha cream and lacing. Light bittersweet finish. Tap at Churchkey.

Pitch black, medium sized tan head. Herbal aroma, hops and chocolate, marvelous combination. Taste is bitter chocolate, cocoa, roasted malts, hops, coffee. Soft carbonation, medium body, creamy texture. Long bittersweet cocoa hoppy finish. Spectacular. (Svijet Piva 0,33 bottle)

Oil-black with three inches of medium-brown head, moderate-coarse, frothy. Aroma is coniferous forest, sap, dark chocolate, some bark/earth and toast. Some caramel, hint of apple wood. Body is medium weight, but the carbonation is very low lending it a heavier perceived weight. Starchy and somewhat oily. Carbonation is fat and has little burn. Flavor is sap, spicy-herbal hops, light smooth caramel sweetness, toast/ toasted wood. Overall: defies style conventions. A hoppy milk stout: quite unusual, but nonetheless very yummy!

33cl bottle from biercab store, barcelona. Dark brown dark color. Brown head. Body is medium. Taste is medium bitter, low sweet. Aroma is chocolate, light milk, light roast, hop. Maybe too much hop aroma, but still nice.
Czarne. Bezowa piana. W aromacie kawa, bardzo delikatna laktoza. W smaku malo slodkie, z wysoka goryczka... Ma?o w tym milk stouta

Pours super dark with nice one finger tan head that lingers. Sweetness comes across in the aroma, with roasty or chocolate notes. Taste is more bitter than expected, with burnt flavors. But there is a good layer of sweetness on second taste. Good stout.
Not a huge fan of this. Licoricey, weirdly hoppy, kinda reminds me of jelly beans. Disappointing.

330 ml bottle
Black beer with big cloudy light brown head leaving lacing. Aroma has pine, licorice, salmiakki and dark chocolate. Flavor has pine, rubber, licorice, fruits and lactosey sweetness. Palate is medium full with quite heavy carbonation and bitterness. Finish has quite heavy bitterness. Aftertaste is roasted with licorice, syrup, grapefruit, light roastiness and lactosey sweetness. Interesting Black IPA variation with lactose.

Bottle. Pours dark with massive beige, stable, long-lasting head which also gives a very nice lacing. Another good looking beer by To Øl. Very interesting aroma, a definately not boring mixture of grinded espresso, coffee beans, dark chocolate and some roasted malt - very raw but pleasant. Expecting the beer to be sweet from lactose I was surprised to find it very dry with sweetish feel and bitter finish. Lactose is definately there but appears in very distincive, unusual way. The bittersweet aftertaste is very enjoyable. Alcohol is well hidden. With almost full body the beer is very drinkable and these 33cl makes me want more of it.

Pours a brown thin head and a very dark color. Smells a combination between a hint of coffee and chocolate and roasted malt. At first there is a hint of sweet lactose and malt and at the end you can feel the full roasted malt in a pleasant after taste. This beer has a medium to full body but its very drinkable, just to enjoy. A realy good sweet stout.

330 ml bottle @ Haandverkerstuene May 2014. Very dark brown, almost black body with a dense, small, brown head. Aroma of dark malt, light roast, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is medium sweet, dark, light roasted malt, dry fruit, light bitter and some warming alcohol. Fine body and good aftertaste. Nice and easy, maybe a bit one-dimensional.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2015 Pours black with a thick brown head. Rich aromas of cream, coffee, chocolate. Quite a bitter finish for a milk stout. Thick creamy mouthfeel. Really very nice indeed.
dark brown colour, medium sized beige head; aroma of coffee, milk chocolte and hints of liqueur; taste of roasted coffe, mild souris and sweet notes as well as slight citruses; good sweet stout

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2015 Black, very strong brown head. Chocolate, vanilla and light hoppiness (the noble kind, it seems) on the nose. Lovely thick mouthfeel, chocolate, roasted malt, tingling bitterness - Im loving this. Finishes a bit hoppy and spicy, in a nice contrast, and warming. This might be among my all-time favourites.

Dark hue. Chocolate, espresso aroma. Lacey head. Immediately when drinking it you can sense the care put into its creation. Full bodied. Bitter but sweet aftertaste. A beer meant for a cool day or slightly warming day. I would like to taste a barrel aged version of this, with the abv turned up. Overall a good beer.

33cl bottle
Appearance: Black with a massive thick, bubbly beige head . Leaving some good lacing.
Aroma: Cocoa powder, vanilla, roasted malts, fresh coffee and soome resinious hops.
Taste: Quite sweet, but never cloying. Cocoa Powder, light caramel with some bitterness of roasted malts and coffee tones, again someresinious hops in spices are there in the finish. Aftertaste is a bit short.

Palate: fullbody. /medium carbonation. Silky mouthfeel. 

Very good brew with the only flaw its aftertaste is a bit on the short live side. Rich taste, full body with reasonable 7% ABV,

Pours a greasy looking black with a big thick white head.nose is chocolate and a bit grassy. Taste is solid! Chocolate, mint/herbal and some bitter leathery taste. Taste is almost like BIPA. I dig it. To øl can have my babies whenever

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 27/11/18. Bardzo bujna, ciemna, brunatno-brazowa piana, zroznicowane te pecherzyki, opada stosunkowo wolno do korzuszka nierownego, ladnie zostaje na szkle. Aromat bardzo intensywny, glownie palanosc, ale tez czekolada (gorzka, nie mleczna), kakao, pralinki, kandyzowany cukier, sliwki w czekoladzie... W smaku wiekszosc z powyzszych tez czuc, czuc tez slodowosc, Wszystko ladnie ulozone, zharmonizowane. Po kazdym lyku na dlugo pozostaja posmaki, lekka goryczka i kwaskowatosc. Bardzo pelne. Sama tekstura przesympatyczna w odbiorze, gesta, lepka, kremowa, oleista. Wysycenie gorne stany niskiego. Mozna smakowac malymi lyczkami. Klasa. ta sama warka, troszke inne wrazenia - tym razem przeszkadzala mi nieco kwaskowatosc, ktora o dziwo tym silniejsza byla im chlodniejsze piwo. Reszta - bez zmian :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle (12 oz).

Appearance: Black with a massive thick, bubbly mocha head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Cocoa powder, moderate sweetness, vanilla, light spiciness and fresh grounded coffee.

Taste: Moderately sweet and never cloying. Cocoa powder along vanilla, coffee, light caramel, hints of spices, a touch of berries and very light bitterness. 

Palate: Medium body. Moderate/medium carbonation. Silky mouthfeel. A tad oily too. Short lasting aftertaste. 

Overall: Im usually not a fan of Sweet Stouts, but I dont have much bad things to say about this one. The balance is impressive, its quite tasty, not too sweet and quite easy to drink for the style. It might be a tad too perfumy, but Im being picky here.

WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, z rubinowymi refleksami. Piana koloru beżowego, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, stosunkowo trwała, zdobi szkło (lacing).
AROMAT: Kawowo-czekoladowy. W tle orzechy (włoskie), torf, przyjemna paloność, SMAK: Łagodna kawa z ekspresu z dodatkiem czekolady deserowej.
Noire. Belle mousse brune. Sucré. Belle amertume. Mince. Légèrement métallique. Un peu vanillé. Biscuit. Terreuse/betterave. Chocolaté. Simple.
Black pour. Big tan head. Tons of lacing. Peppery malt aroma. Peppery chocolate taste. Creamy.
Malty - hoppy aroma, a bit woody. Creamy brown head. Chocolate brownish colour. Taste comes mostly from coffee bitteness but also some sweetness.

The pour is thick with a generous foam head. Pitch black in appearance.

The nose shows a lot of resinous dry hops and citrus. 

The palate shows quite a lot of the same. Despite being a stout, the only stout portion is the mouth-feel - big, thick, luxurious. I hardly pick up any of the milk or lactose on the palate. 

Without a doubt, its interesting, but as a sweet stout not so much.
Nuchtere Noorden Tasting ILekker combinatie tussen zoet en bitter, Mooie sweet stout met een goeie bitter erbij.

Bottle from punka in Tallinn ( 3.74). BB 07/2019. Pours a very dark brown colour; dark tan head with good retention and lacing. Aroma is massive - dark+bitter+milk chocolate, also somewhat minty+herbal+fresh background coming from the hops. Taste is surprisingly non-sweet but still very chocolaty, cocoa+cola+coffee minus 3/4 of the sugars, and loads of roasted malts and resiny-piney bitterness in the finish. Body is indeed heavy on the tongue; texture velvety smooth and soft with minimal carbonation. Overall a beautiful, surprisingly non-sweet, heavy-hopped brew! I love such stuff!

Deep black pour with a thin light khaki ring of foam. Rich sumptuous nose with some roasty coffee and dark cocoa booze ester. Big roasty flavor with some earthy bittersweet cocoa and a touch or smoky coffee and maybe a bit of un-sweet licorice. Its a bit much overall but still fun to drink.

@Nuchtere Noorden Tasting I, 7%, sweet stout, schenkt zwart met volle schuimige en fijne bruine kraag. Smaken zijn redelijk hoppig en bitter voor een sweet stout, den, nat gras, vind hem eerlijk gezegd qua smaak en beleving eerder op een BIPA lijken. verder een matige body, vrij lang bittertje in de afdronk, lage co2, smaken blijven wel lang hangen, aardig wel maar géén topper..

Bottle at Baran, Bergen. Pours a black colour with a big, creamy, light brown head. Roasted aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and grassy hops. The flavour is also pretty roasted with more grassy hops, grapefruit and coffee in the background. Has a slick mouth feel and a balanced bitterness. A really nice black IPA (?).

Black pour with a 1 finger, creamy mocha head that has excellent retention and leaves great lacing. Every sip brings a new cascade of lacing streaking downward from the point where my lip met the glass. Aroma is loaded with roast, chocolate, toast and lactose, then some dark caramel, toffee nuts, earthy and woody notes and a little booziness. Flavor is mocha sweetened with lactose, toffee, roast, a little char, earth, old campfire wood, light earthy notes, and light fruity and floral notes toward the finish. Medium to heavy body, creamy entry, chewy middle, light, blanketing and mildly sharp carbonation, syrupy, but chalky finish. There is a lingering feeling of sharp carbonation on the tongue that is very strange. Good stuff overall, I do dig Lacto Stouts in general and this has lots of components to make it awesome, but just enough throwing it off to make it just "good". Okay, maybe "really good". While I liked this beer quite a bit it is a terrible value. I paid $6.50/355ml (or maybe 330ml?) bottle. There are better stouts to be had for a little more than that price for six times the volume. That assertion doesnt affect my score, but it is worth noting.
4/1/2014. 12 oz. bottle. Pours black with a foamy tan head. Aromas are roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Creamy texture with chocolate and coffee flavors and a light bitter finish.

Piwo dobre czarne intensywne palone pachnace slodem pieczonym tostem, a w smaku lekko mleczne i stoutowe. Wytrawne mimo lekkiego wrazenia slodyczy w pierwszej fazie degustacji. Brazowawa spora piana, srednio trwala. Rozgrzewajaca i tresciwa sycaca koncowka.
Smells and tastes like cappuccino. Light sweetness and creamy mouth feel with a perfect bitter roast finish.

A black beer with a cold appearance and a thin foam residue. The aroma is dark plum cocoa and wood. The flavor is plum, dried cocoa powder and bitter apple peel with a roasted.l malty cocoa finish. Its too strong to be any more appreciated.
Pitch black, khaki head. Chocolate, lacto, roasted malts, and sweet. Chewy palate, lacto, heavy roasted malts, chocolate, and light coffee.

Pine, chocolate and toasted malts greet the nose. A slowly dissipating khaki head sits atop a deep reddish brown pour providing ample fine lacing. Whoa! This is a richly rewarding robust taste experience. Roasted malt, pine, chocolate and dark coffee notes all delivered with a full body and medium carbonation. Smooth round mouthfeel. Overall, this is a WINNER plain and simple!

Barwa; czarna nieprzejrzysta, piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, obfita i gesta. Wzorowo.

Botella de 33 cl de 2d2dspuma tomada en julio de 2013. Una autentica sorpresa de stout con un cuerpo medio y cremoso de 7 vol y un sabor increíble, parece mas bien una black ipa. Imprescindible repetir. Sabores tostados, especias, lácteos y amargos genialmente combinados. Muy buena.

11.2 oz bottle from Mile High Wine & Spirits. Black with a lacy brown head, slowly dissipating. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, bitter chocolate, pine, lactose and light caramel. Similar flavor, robust and semi-sweet with a nice hoppy bitter balance. Medium body with a creamy, semi-dry feel and a rich, lasting finish. Good.

Pours viscously to rusty-dark beige head, very stable and leaving textbook lace over virtually black beer. Hops, very dry nose, touch or ureum, and something not unlike maltsyrup. Strange flavour, both meaty (udder???) but also - and mainly - like fertilzer smelll. Follows a more typical burnt/roasted stoutflavour, but the finish is again different, sweet-like and thick, no doubt the lactose. Warming up, the finish acquires some peppery touch, which saves it a bit in the end.  Feels utterly thick, creamy, pap. Well-carbonated. Not likely to become one of my favourites. Udder, indeed.

Bottle from Specs. Black with a large light brown pillowy head. Aroma of molasses, roast, coffee, and citrus peel. Tastes well roasted, semi-sweet, and mildly bitter. Medium bodied, smooth. Very nice.
Milk stout da urlo, con intenso gusto cioccolatoso, di caffé e una cremosità intrigante e lattosa da far venire i brividi di piacere! Questa birra è semplicemente fantastica!
Svært farve med høyt beige skum. Lukt av malt og sjokolade. Smak av malt, sjokolade og lakris. Fruktig. Melkebaren.
Dyp sort farge. Kremet brunt skum, hengende langs kant.. Duft av bek, kaffe og lakris. God smak av kaffe, karamell og vanilje.

On tap at The Earl of Essex Islington. Black beer collar of tan bubbles. Thick and unctuous beer. Lots of deep lovely dark chocolate. I just want to melt. Decent hop on the finish too. I can see why its so highly rated. Intense smooth chocolate. Wow amazing. I love it. Except for the too hoppy bitter finish. Good though. Oh and served way too cold

Bottle. Poured a dark black with a khaki head that lasted throughout and some appealing lacing. Taste of chocolate milk, cocoa, and dark malts. High carbonation, medium-thick body. Overall, not too sweet, well balanced.

Black color with brown nice head, lacing glass. Aroma is surprise, is very hoppy. We have grass, pines, some citrus mixed with smooth dark chocolate and coffee background. Taste is wonderfull balanced between bitterness and sweetness. Notes of hops, grass, citrus and pines with dark chocolate, milk chocolate and coffee. Like some mild Black IPA. Texture is very smooth, velvet, creamy. Medium body with medium carbonation. Im positively surprised. Fantastic, unique and original interpretation of Milk Stout.

Bottle sample at a tasting in Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Tom L. Black with tan head. Hoppy, lemon and some wood in the nose, bittersweet coffee - slightly roasty but also lemon in the mouth. Medium-bodied, delicate bitterness and some coffee finish.
sampled at olbaren copenhagen. black with a lasting brown head; aroma of ashtray, pine and vanilla cream; loads of bitterness, firm texture, cocoa butter with some stonefruit

At a tasting, thanks tom, no head, very dark brown to black colour, suprising hop forward piney citrusy aroma with some roasted coffee, dark chocolate, with some dark bread, nuts and dark fruit, medium bitterness. Good, fun and original,

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Tom L. Black with a nice big tan head. Aroma of piney hops, roastiness and chocolate. Poured deep dark brown with a foamy beige head. Aroma of sweet milk chocolate, toasted malt. Medium body, flavour of the aroma, medium coffee, slight bitterness in the finish.

Rich milk chocolate pour with a small latte head. Burnt marshmallow, light hoppy character, cocoa, and lactic qualities. Creamy mouthfeel. But above average.
light burnt hoppy aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, soft carbonation, light burnt and licorice finish.

Det här var rätt juste, smaken hade mycket rostade toner och inslag av choklad och något som skulle kunna vara mjölk. Kroppen var lite tunn men balansen var fin.

Looks amazing, large creamy dark tanned head on a opaque, dark brown body. Milkchocolate and coffee on the nose, roasted malts. Quite bitter with decent chocolate sweetness, well balanced actually. Thick and creamy on the palate, softly carbonated.
On tap. Black with a creamy tan head. Sweet cereal grain, milk chocolate, drip coffee, and roasted grain aroma and taste with a thick creamy palate.

Lovely stout!

Bottle. Black color, brown head with decent retention and solid lacing. Aroma of burnt espresso and dark chocolate. Taste is dark cocoa and ovaltine. Nice.

Pour dark black with frothy tan head. Sweet coffee and toasted malts on the nose with enticing hints of lactose and sweet sugars. Sweet flavor follows with lactic qualities and a well balanced roasted chocolate flavor. Delicious stout.

Bottle from Ølbutikken. Black with a big and lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, chocolate and moderate hoppy - pine. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 230413
Bottle. Almost black with big dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hop and pine. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, medium sweet, hop, medium bitter and pine.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Has a roasted malty hoppy bitter citrus chocolate aroma. Roasted malty hoppy bitter chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty hoppy bitter chocolate finish.

Such a solid beer. Bottle from Mikkeller and Friends (Came wrapped in beautiful blue tissue paper, cheers). Plenty of almost beige head, bigger bubles than expected. And the nose can also be added to the unexpected column, for a lactose dark beer, it comes at your sniffer with pinecones and buiscuts, an unlikely but welcome mix indeed! Once you take the plunge, it starts to slide down with the more familiar sweetness of a milk stout making way for yet another unexpected patter of fresh american pale ale-esque hops which work terrifically in tandem with the sweetness of the lactose. Once these lovers have made their way off into the night, the beer leaves you in a velvet lounge of afterstastes to savour the dark truffles and machiato on offer well after the party has made its way to your stomach leaving you with only one, very easy question; another?

On tap at Pudel Baar. Pours nice and thick. Great tan head. Aroma is of sweet lactose, roasted malt, smoke and dark fruits. Taste is very good, with all the aromas coming through on the palate too. Great body, nice and creamy.

330ml bottle. Black colour with huge, frothy to creamy, fully lasting, moderately lacing, brown head. Intense piney hop aroma. Taste is roasty dark malty, subtle sweetness, hints of coffee and chocolate, excellent bitter hoppy overtones, minimally tart touch, lasting bitter hoppy finish. Well balanced, very drinkable, excellent stuff.
Bottle. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich hops, roast malt, chocolate and coffee. Long bitter hoppy finish. More like a black ipa.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, April 2013.

Black with a creamy, tan head. Nice aroma of hops, roasted malt, coffee and licorice. Similar taste. Sweet, a bit sprawling but a tasty beer.

On tap at The Trappist. Pours dark brown with a thick multi-toned tan head and a very strange aroma, consisting of treacle, chocolate, citrus and pine. There is a full-bodied smoked and dark malt flavor with an intensely piney hop finish.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, milk chocolate, nuts, and hops. Flavour is roasted malt, sweet chocolate, and some hoppy bitterness in the finish.

Bottle. Black beer with a rich lasting brownish head. Roasted aroma, caramel, dark chocolate, pine, bitter hops, cocoa powder, some tropical fruits, creamy notes. Roasted aroma, tropical fruits, earthy, cocoa powder, pine. Roasted chocolate finish with tropical fruits, soot and pine. I really like how complex this beer is.

0.33 l bottle, thanks hanniku! Black color. Sweet and roasty aroma with grassy coffee, charred bread and hint of smoke. Sweet coffeish flavor with dark bread, dark fruits, dark sugar, grass as well as hint of smoke, oak and  menthol. Full body. Good dessert stout.

Black pour with a tab head. Nose is nicely sweet from the lactose, but also a nice coffee and chocolate character. Maybe a bit of hop aroma, plenty of roast, and some hints of earth. The flavor is moderately sweet. Good lactose, some hints of caramel, earth, and a subtle bitterness of coffee and roasted malt.

Keg. Pitch black color. Medium size, creamy brown head. Holds quite nicely. Aromatic hops dominates aroma leaving very few room for others. But flowers, camomille is detectable. Taste is quite different. Roasted malts, spiced with hops, dry milk powder in taste. Artificial milky texture. Dry woody mouthfeel.

Bottle. It pours black with a dense beige head that leave great lacings in the glass. The aroma is quite hoppy with notes of peach, citrus and light roast. The flavor is pine, licorice, peach, mocca and light roast. Creamy milky texture. Great!!

UPDATED: APR 28, 2013 Keg (Pudel Baar, Tallinn)
Sweet nutty cakey aroma, as well as a lovely rich smooth burnt roast. The nuttiness is more like  the slightly burnt flaked almonds, glazed of course, youd get on top of a cake. A little weird in places occasionally. Looks good, basically black, with a tight keggy tan head. Smooth palate, pleasantly crispened by the carbonation. More burnt than the aroma indicated, but not ashy or astringent. Alcohol well in check. Taste mellowed nicely by the residual sweetness. Its not as lactosey sweet as many othe milk stouts Ive had, Im not a bif fan of that. Im guessing the yeast attenuated the available sugars quite fully, so the lactose just filled in the gap left, and it does that well. Finish mostly a burnt roast, and some twiggy bitterness. Just the occasional weirdness stops this from being a "wow", but this is very solid. To 0l ROCK!
Rerate: Tap (Pudel Baar, Tallinn) 
Great roast, and a nice twist of nettle too. Deep roast, lovely and rich. Still just as good. Possibly even less sweet than last time. Worth every point.

Tap. Dark brown, beige head. Nose is creamy, velvety, hoppy, roasty, notes of milk chocolate, coffee. Taste is also pretty smooth and creamy with roast, malt, chocolate, roasty-hoppy bitter finish with citric hops. Full body, smooth palate, smooth carbonation. Great.

Bottle, bought @ Kihoskh, Cph.
Pours deep black with a firm, staying, creamy, light brown head. Aroma has coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate, coconut and clear lactose. Medium carbonation, fine dry and fairly light mouthfeel for the ABV. Flavour is nicely roasted, sweet lactose, still some coconut, hazel, light cold coffee. A very nice milk stout.

Bottled. Pitch Black coloured. Dense light Brown head. Aroma. Herbs, Cocoa, sweetness, laktose,. Flavour. Herbs, unroasted coffee, grass, sweetness, laktose, medium to full bodied. Ends roasted and Dry bitter.

01-MAR-2013, bottle @home, from Ølbutikken.
Black with lasting high brown head.
Aroma malts in the form of chocolate and licorice.
Taste the same. Mily and with gun powder - lactic.
Lively carbonation and medium body. Off course it is hoppy as well. It is To Øl. Mostly citric hops. Fine stout.

To celebrate my 12.000th Rating. Thought it was suitable doing a beer from the currently best Danish brewery . Pours black with a creamy beige head. Hoppy and roasted nose. Ashes, roast and grapefruit. Smooth and full bodied. Flavor is chocolate, ashes, roast and grapefruit. Bitter hoppy and roasted finish.

RB Odense Official February tasting. Black with a firm and lasting tan head. Aroma of citrus hops, licorice and roasted malt. Sweetish roasted flavour with ash and charcoal, some licorice and chocolate and lots of citrus hops. Notable lactose sweetness, but with plenty of balancing hop bitterness

33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2013, with lactose, from Ølbutikken Copenhagen, complex sweet Stout, roasted/sweet and slightly bitter/fruity, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, good brew, yet expensive

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma and taste is of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and sugar. Smooth and sweet with a medium body. Not much bite to it (tastewise) and nothing too special, but I would happily drink again. ;-)
Draft. A pitch black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, chocolate, and roasted bread.
